By not depleting or overcoming the spleen and earth element, there arises an opportunity for the spleen's energy to rejuvenate, naturally allowing the large intestine to facilitate its functions. In addition, the bitter orange peel, areca nut, and radish seeds all serve as excellent medicines to eliminate impurities and remove accumulation, particularly effective in supplementary remedies combined with attack.[125p]

    而滑石、甘草、木香，调和于迟速之间，更能不疾不徐，使瘀滞之尽下，而无内留之患也。其余些小痢疾，不必用如此之多，减半治之，亦无不奏功。前方不必分红白、痛与不痛，皆神效。　　痢疾之证，多起于暑天之郁热，而又感以水湿雨露之气以成之。红白相间，如血如脓，甚者如屋漏水、如鱼冻水，里急后重，奔迫疼痛，欲下而不能，下而不快，日夜数十行，或日夜数百行，气息奄奄，坐而待毙。若骤止其邪则死生顷刻，不止其邪则危绝如丝。欲补其气则邪气转加，欲清其火则下行更甚。此时惟有因势利导之法可行。或疑人已气虚血败，更加利导必死。不知邪气一刻不去，则正气一刻不安。古人云：痢疾无止法，信不诬也。[126p]

    The substances talc, licorice, and wood incense, when harmonized between slow and fast, can effectively eliminate stagnation without causing any internal issues. For mild dysentery, such a large amount is unnecessary; halving the dosage will also yield results. There is no need to differentiate between red and white or between pain and no pain; all are effective.

    The symptoms of dysentery often arise from the heat and humidity of summer, aggravated by atmospheric moisture from rain and dew. The discharge may appear mixed, resembling blood and pus; in severe cases, it can be as bad as leaking roofs or frozen fish, accompanied by urgency, heaviness, and pain, with a strong desire to defecate but inability to do so, or defecation without relief. It may occur dozens or even hundreds of times day and night, leaving one gasping, waiting for death.

    If the disorder is abruptly halted, one may die instantly; if not controlled, danger remains ever-present. Attempts to replenish vital energy may worsen the evil qi, while efforts to clear heat may exacerbate the downward flow. At this moment, only a method that follows the situation can be employed. If it is suspected that one is already deficient in energy and blood, further purging will surely lead to death. It is not understood that as long as the evil qi persists, the vital qi will remain unsettled. The ancients said: "There is no stopping method for dysentery," and this statement is not in vain.[126p]

    方用白芍、当归各三两，萝卜子一两，枳壳、槟榔、甘草、车前子各三钱，水煎服，一剂即止，二剂全安，可用饮食矣。此方之奇，全在用白芍、当归。盖水泻最忌当归之滑，而痢疾最喜其滑也。芍药味酸，入肝以平木，使木不敢再侵脾土；又有枳壳、槟榔，消逐其湿热之邪；又加车前分利其水湿，而又不耗真阴之水，所以功胜于茯苓也。尤奇在用萝卜子一味，世多不解。盖萝卜子味辣而能逐邪去湿，且又能上下通达。消食利气，使气行于血分之中，助归、芍以生新血，而袪荡其败瘀也。少加甘草以和中，则无过烈之患。此奏功之神奇，实有妙理耳。　　血痢有腹痛不痛之分。[127p]

    The formula includes three taels of white peony and angelica, one tael of radish seeds, and three qian each of bitter orange peel, betel nut, licorice, and plantain seeds, boiled in water and taken as a decoction. One dose is sufficient; after two doses, one is completely at ease, and can return to normal diet. The uniqueness of this formula lies in the use of white peony and angelica. Water-dampness most abhors the slippery nature of angelica, whereas dysentery favors it. Peony has a sour taste that enters the liver to pacify wood, so that it dares not invade the spleen-earth again. Additionally, there are bitter orange and betel nut to dispel damp-heat, along with plantain seeds to promote the flow of dampness without depleting true kidney yin, thus this formula is even more effective than poria. Particularly remarkable is the inclusion of radish seeds, a point often overlooked by many. Radish seeds have a spicy flavor that can dispel evils and eliminate dampness, and they also promote communication both upwards and downwards. They aid digestion and facilitate qi movement within the blood, assisting angelica and peony to generate new blood and eliminate stagnation. A little licorice is added to harmonize the formula, thus avoiding excessive potency. The remarkable efficacy of this preparation indeed contains profound principles. Blood dysentery can be differentiated by the presence or absence of abdominal pain.[127p]

    痛者，乃大热也，用归尾、白芍各一两，黄连三钱，枳壳、萝卜子、广木香各二钱，甘草一钱，水煎服。不痛者，乃寒也。白芍、当归各三钱，萝卜子二钱，枳壳、槟榔、甘草各一钱，水煎服。又曰：血痢者，乃肝经来克脾土也。虽因脾土之湿，又加暑热暗侵，瓜果内伤所致，然终因肝木太旺无制，凌脾土而然也。方用白芍、当归滋肝而平木，肝木得养，不来下克脾土，则土亦得养而血痢自痊矣。夫血痢虽有痛、不痛之分，其实皆火邪而挟湿气也。论理当与泄门白朮、车前之方，俱可通治。而分别痛、不痛之分乃慎之也。二方出入加减各为神效，不必畏首畏尾，一用之于痛，一用之于不痛也。盖火邪带湿气，居于肠胃之际，不得奔下，未有不急而后重者。用当归、白芍滑而利之，则火邪利于直下不止，平肝木而救脾土也。古今图书集成医部全录卷二百六十一[128p]

    For pain, it is due to great heat. Use one tael each of Ligusticum and white peony, three qian of Coptis, two qian each of bitter orange peel and radish seed, one qian of licorice, and decoct in water for consumption. For those without pain, it is due to cold. Use three qian each of white peony and Ligusticum, two qian of radish seed, and one qian each of bitter orange peel, betel nut, and licorice, and decoct in water for consumption.

    Furthermore, it is said: blood dysentery arises from the liver channel invading the spleen and earth element. Although this is due to the spleen’s dampness compounded by summer heat and concealed injury from fruits, it ultimately arises because the liver wood is too strong, overpowering the spleen earth. To remedy this, use white peony and Ligusticum to nourish the liver and subdue the wood. When the liver wood is nourished, it will not attack the spleen earth, allowing the earth to be nourished and thus curing the blood dysentery.

    Even though blood dysentery can be categorized by pain or no pain, it essentially involves fire evils accompanied by dampness. Logically, it should be treated similarly to prescriptions for diarrhea with Atractylodes and Plantago, and must be approached with caution regarding pain or no pain. The two prescriptions may be adjusted for efficacy; there is no need to fear strict classifications, as one treats pain and the other non-pain. Fire evils with dampness dwell in the intestines and stomach; if they cannot descend promptly, they inevitably lead to urgency and heaviness. Using Ligusticum and white peony will facilitate smooth excretion, allowing fire evils to descend without cessation, while harmonizing the liver wood and aiding the spleen earth.[128p]

    滞下门

    　　　　方

    　　桃花汤 【仲景】 　治伤寒下痢，便脓血不止。　　赤石脂一斤，一半全用，一半筛末　干姜一两　粳米半升　　右水七升，煮米熟去滓，每服七合，纳赤石脂末方寸匕，日三服，愈。
    　　桃花丸 【《局方》】 　治冷痢腹痛，下白冻如鱼脑。　　赤石脂煅干姜炮，各等分
    　　右为末，蒸饼和丸，量大小服，日三服。
    　　金宝神丹 【《杨氏家藏方》】 　治一切虚冷，久积滑泄，久痢癖块，血刺心腹，下痢，及妇人崩中漏下。　　青蒙石半斤　消石二两
    　　右为末，坩锅内铺头盖底按实，炭火二十斤，煅过取出，入赤石脂末二两，滴水丸芡子大，候干入坩锅内，小火煅红收之。每服一丸至二三丸，空心温水下少许压之。久病泻痢加至五七丸。[129p]

    Zhi Xia Men (Stagnation Under the Door)

    Peach Blossom Decoction (Zhongjing)
    Used for treating cold damage with diarrhea, with persistent pus and blood.
    One pound of red shijie, half used in full, half sifted into powder.
    One tael of dried ginger.
    Half a sheng of polished rice.
    Add seven shengs of water, cook the rice until soft, remove the dregs, take seven jiao each dose, mix in a teaspoon of red shijie powder, take three times daily, and it will cure.

    Peach Blossom Pills (Ju Fang)
    Used for treating cold dysentery with abdominal pain, resulting in white stools resembling fish brains.
    Red shijie, roasted dried ginger, each in equal parts.
    Grind into powder, steam and mix with dough to form pills, taking as appropriate size, three times daily.

    Golden Treasure Divine Elixir (Yang Shi Family Collection)
    Used for all forms of cold deficiency, prolonged slippery diarrhea, chronic dysentery causing blockages, blood stabbing in the heart and abdomen, diarrhea, and women's uterine bleeding with spotting.
    Half a pound of green mengshi, two taels of xiaoshi.
    Grind into powder, lay at the bottom of a crucible and press firmly, using twenty pounds of charcoal for roasting, then take out, add two taels of red shijie powder, form into pills the size of lotus seeds, wait for them to dry, then place into the crucible, roast slowly until red, and retrieve. Take one to two or three pills each time, taking with a small amount of warm water on an empty stomach. For chronic diarrhea, increase to five to seven pills.[129p]

    Used to treat summer heat diarrhea, intestinal wind with blood, or blood from alcohol toxicity.

    Treats dysentery with symptoms of urgency and possibly diarrhea.
    Ingredients:
    Huang Lian and Fresh Ginger each 4 liang, Mu Xiang 2 liang.

    Bian Tong Wan (from "Bai Yi Xuan Fang")
    Treats both red and white diarrhea, occurring excessively day and night, and rectal bleeding.

    Dusheng Pill: Treats prolonged dysentery, both red and white.     Tuiyin Powder: Treats dysentery with cough and reversal, pulse deep, indicative of yin deficiency and coldness.     Bai Tou Weng Decoction: Treats bloody diarrhea due to retained heat that fails to heal for months.     Fu Ling Decoction: Treats exhaustion from severe diarrhea leading to the sensation of impending death, and blood and pus discharge several times a day, leading to exhaustion and potential death; suitable for both young and old. Ingredients: Fu Ling, Huang Bo, Huang Lian, Long Gu, Ren Shen, Gan Jiang, Gui, Huang Qin, Shao Yao, Dang Gui, Zhi Zi (stir-fried), Gan Cao, each 30 grams; Chi Shi Zhi 60 grams; twelve jujubes. This formula is especially effective for wind, cold, and slippery dysentery.[138p]

    Cangmi Decoction
    Treats accumulation of cold qi in the lower abdomen, leading to cold diarrhea, with daily occurrences of thirty to forty times.
    Half a sheng of Cangjing rice, thoroughly rinsed; one handful of Xiebai, trimmed and finely chopped; one sheng of sheep fat, rendered; three sheng of fragrant soybean, using one dou of water, decoct to obtain five sheng, clarified.
    First, use the sheep fat to fry the Xiebai until golden, then combine it with the soybean juice and rice, decoct to obtain four sheng. Take one sheng warm on an empty stomach in the morning, and if you walk about ten li, take another sheng for quick relief. If diarrhea does not stop, continue to take as before. After relief, consume rice porridge with soybean. If it recurs, take one more dose for a complete cure.

    Ganli Formula
    Treats black excessive dampness from gan, when physicians are unable to treat and patients are near death.
    Ingredients include:
    Xunhuang, Zhushā, Qīngdài, Shiyán, Lángdāngzi, Dīngxiāng, Shèxiāng, Fánshí, Tiěyī, Gānjiāng, powdered remains of old shoe soles, Zhīzǐ, Xìxīn, dry toads collected on the fifth day of the fifth month, Tǔguāgēn, Jièzǐ, Shǔjiāo, Tínglì, and Chāngpú, all in equal parts.
    A total of nineteen ingredients, treated by filtering downward, to be blown into the affected areas with a bamboo tube through a large hole the size of an almond. Apply this mixture to all affected gan sores. The Dīngxiāng and Shèxiāng should be ground separately, then mixed into the medicine. Another formulation includes Hánshí, Gān diàn, Jiùyuè mù, and Qiūyè as twenty-two ingredients. For larger issues, use an irrigation formula as follows:
    (Irrigation formula)[143p]

    　　麝香　丁香　甘草　犀角各二分
    　　右四味，治下筛，合和。以盐三合，蜀椒三合，豉二合，以水二升，煮取一升，去滓，内四味散合和，分作二分，灌大孔，旦一灌、酉一灌之。凡久下一月不瘥成疳，候大孔必宽者，以此主之。　　又方　治疳湿久，下痢赤白，百疗不瘥者。　　兔头骨灰　蛇头灰　菥蓂子灰　故绯灰　葶苈子　狸骨一作狐骨　蜣螂　百草五月五日收者　倒挂草　青黛　晚蚕蛾　青矾　丁香　黄矾　床中桄木　麝香　苦参　干姜　黄蘗　角蒿　朱砂　印成盐　救月木　桂心　铁衣芒硝　虾蟆　蝎虫屎　荏子各等分　　右二十九味，治下筛，以筒子内下部吹着，日一二度，妙。[144p]

    Musk, clove, licorice, and rhino horn, each two parts.

    Combine these four ingredients to treat downward disorders. Mix with three parts salt, three parts Sichuan pepper, and two parts fermented soybeans. Use two liters of water, boil down to one liter, strain, and mix in the four powdered ingredients. Divide into two portions and administer through a large hole: one in the morning and one in the evening. If persistent symptoms of dysentery last for a month and indicate a wide hole, this is the treatment to follow.

    Additionally, for chronic damp dysentery, both red and white, that does not improve despite various treatments:

    Use ash from rabbit skulls, snake heads, and from other listed ingredients, such as mustard seeds, and various herbal components. Gather the herbs on the fifth day of the fifth month and dry them. The remaining ingredients, including blue indigo, silkworm moths, green vitriol, yellow vitriol, bed wood, musk, bitter seal, dried ginger, yellow barberry, horseradish, vermilion, sea water salt, moonflower, cassia heart, iron and sulfur, toad, and scorpion dung, should be in equal parts.

    These twenty-nine ingredients treat downward disorders by being administered through a tube into the lower body, ideally once or twice daily for best results.[144p]

    　　又方　治疳湿不能食，身重，心热，脚冷，百节疼痛。　　黄芩　芍药　苦参　甘草　当归　蜀椒　青黛　甘松一作泔淀　熏黄　豉各二两　盐一合　东引桃根　葱白各一握　麝香半分　猪胆二枚　　右十五味(口父)咀，以水一斗八升，煮取四升，分为二分，一度灌一分，汤如入体，然后着麝香猪胆一枚，即灌，灌了作葱豉粥食之。后日，更将一分如前灌之，七日忌生冷毒物等。但是油腻酱乳酢三十日忌之，大佳。　　又秘方　治疳蚀人诸处，但是赤血痢久不瘥，立着即瘥。　　人屎灰一作人发灰　金银土埚各五两　麝香一分　银末小豆许　干虾蟆五月五日收，一枚，烧灰研　　右五味治下筛，敷疮上即瘥。三七日，忌如前。痢者吹下部。　　又方　治疳痢不止。[145p]

    Another prescription for treating dampness and inability to eat due to malnutrition, with heaviness in the body, heat in the heart, cold feet, and pain in all joints.

    Ingredients:

    • Huang Qin (Scutellaria baicalensis)
    • Shao Yao (Paeonia lactiflora)
    • Ku Shen (Sophora flavescens)
    • Gan Cao (Glycyrrhiza uralensis)
    • Dang Gui (Angelica sinensis)
    • Shu Jiao (Zanthoxylum bungeanum)
    • Qing Dai (indigo naturalis)
    • Gan Song (Atractylodes lancea) made into a decoction
    • Xun Huang (fuming yellow)
    • Chi (fermented soybeans) each two taels
    • Salt one he
    • Dong Yin Tao Gen (peach root)
    • Green onion white each one handful
    • Musk half fen
    • Pig gallbladder two pieces

    Preparation:
    Combine these fifteen ingredients, grind them, and with 1.8 liters of water, boil to yield four liters. Divide into two portions; administer one portion through infusion, then add one piece of musk and one pig gallbladder. Infuse again, then make a porridge with green onion and fermented soybeans to consume. On the following days, administer the other portion as before, and avoid raw, cold, or toxic foods for seven days. Additionally, avoid oily, greasy dishes, dairy, and vinegar for thirty days, yielding excellent results.

    Another secret formula for treating malnutrition affecting various parts of the body; particularly effective for chronic dysentery with red blood that does not heal, it works promptly.

    Ingredients:

    • Human feces ash (or hair ash)
    • Gold and silver mixed soil, each five taels
    • Musk one fen
    • Silver powder, enough for a small bean
    • Dried toad collected on May 5th, one piece, burned to ash

    Preparation:
    Combine these five ingredients thoroughly, sift, and apply to wounds for immediate healing. Follow this regimen for three to seven days, avoiding the same substances as before. For dysentery, blow it into the lower part of the body.

    　　苦参　甘草　熏黄各二两　豉一升五合　葱白五茎　蜀椒三十粒　　右六味，以苦参等三物各捣下筛，以水五升煮葱白、豉、椒，取三升，以三指撮苦参末等各一撮内汁中，冷暖如人体。先饮少许豉汁，食一口饭乃侧卧，徐徐灌之讫，多时卧不出为佳。大急，乃出之于净地，当有疳蚀虫如白马尾状，头黑，是其效也。其重者肛大难瘥，当取桃枝棉裹头，用前件汁适寒温烙之，须近脊以上三十度，烙之乃瘥，神验。　　又方　崔氏云：晋代之地多生疳，蚀人五脏，通见脊骨，下脓血，手足烦疼，四肢无力，夜卧烦躁不安而失血色，肩髀疼，面及手足有浮气，或下血，乃死。以此方治之。　　雄黄　青葙各二两　苦参三两　矾石　雌黄　铁衣　藜芦各一两　麝香三分，别研　　右八味治下筛，以竹筒内大孔中酸枣许，吹内下部中，日一，不过三度。小儿以大豆许。此方极救死。[146p]

    Ku Shen, Gan Cao, and Xun Huang each two taels; one sheng and five he of Dou Chi; five stalks of white onion; thirty grains of Shu Jiao.

    Combine these six ingredients, crushing Ku Shen and the other two into a fine powder, and boil the white onion, Dou Chi, and pepper in five sheng of water until only three sheng remain. Add a pinch each of the ground Ku Shen and other powders into this liquid, adjusting the temperature to that of the human body. Start by drinking a little Dou Chi juice, eat a mouthful of rice, and then lie on your side, gradually drinking the liquid until finished. It is best to remain lying down for an extended period without getting up. In case of urgency, one should expel it in a clean place; there should appear a maggot-like substance similar to a white horse tail with a black head, which indicates effectiveness. In severe cases, if there is considerable difficulty in the anus, take a peach twig, wrap the head, and use the prepared juice at a slightly warm temperature to cauterize, ensuring it is approximately thirty degrees above the spine; this will lead to healing, proving to be remarkably effective.

    Regarding another method, Cui’s observation states: During the Jin dynasty, many suffered from infestation that corroded the internal organs, visible along the spine, leading to pus and blood discharge, causing limb pain, weakness in the arms and legs, nocturnal restlessness, loss of color, shoulder and hip pain, and swelling in face and limbs. If blood is discharged, death may follow. This remedy is used for treatment.

    Ejiao Mei Lian Pill treats dysentery, regardless of duration or symptoms such as red, white, green, black, or pain.

    Prepare the ingredients as follows:

    • Grind transparent white Ejiao with clean herb ash, then fry and grind again if coarse.
    • Fry the pitted flesh of black plum (Wu Mei).
    • Shred and fry yellow huangbo.
    • Include huanglian (coptis).
    • Bake angelica (danggui).
    • Add red peony root (chi shaoyao).
    • Roast dry ginger (ganjiang).
    • Use half a liang of red poria (chi fuling).

    Combine all these into a fine powder and mix with Ejiao to form pills the size of a Chinese parasol seed. Take ten pills with warm rice drink before meals, and up to five or six doses at night. For children, make the pills the size of mung beans. Avoid oily and fatty foods.[150p]

    　　升阳去热和血汤 【东垣，下同】 　治肠澼下血，另作一派，其血唧出有力而远射，四散如筛，肠中血下行，腹中大作痛，乃阳明气冲热毒所作也。当升阳、去湿热、和血脉，是其治也。　　橘皮二分　熟地黄　当归身　苍朮　秦艽　肉桂各三分　生地黄　丹皮　生甘草各五分　炙甘草　黄芪各一钱　升麻七分　芍药一钱半　　右(口父)咀，都作一服，水四盏，煎至一盏，去柤，空心稍热服，立效。
    　　凉血地黄汤　治肠澼，血谷与血另作一派，如唧桶涌出。　　黄蘗去皮銼炒　知母銼炒，各一钱　槐子炒　青皮不去皮穰　熟地黄　当归各五分　　右件(口父)咀，都作一服，水一盏，煎七分，去柤温服。[153p]

    Rising Yang to Expel Heat and Harmonize Blood Decoction

    This treats rectal bleeding. Another type of bleeding occurs with strong, forceful spurts, scattering like a sieve. Blood flows downward in the intestines, causing severe abdominal pain, which results from Yangming energy clashing with heat toxins. The treatment aims to raise Yang, eliminate damp-heat, and harmonize the blood vessels.

    Ingredients:

    • Two parts of orange peel
    • Three parts of cooked rehmannia
    • Three parts of angelica root
    • Three parts of wormwood
    • Three parts of gentian
    • Three parts of cinnamon
    • Five parts of raw rehmannia
    • Five parts of peony root
    • Five parts of raw licorice
    • One part of honey-fried licorice
    • One part of astragalus
    • Seven parts of cimicifuga
    • One and a half parts of peony

    Crush all ingredients to make one dose, using four cups of water. Boil down to one cup, strain, and take warm on an empty stomach. Immediate effect is expected.

    Cool Blood Rehmannia Decoction

    This treats rectal bleeding, with blood gushing forth like a water spout.

    Ingredients:

    • One part of Huangbo (Phellodendron) peel, roasted and ground
    • One part of Anemarrhena, roasted and ground
    • One part of roasted sophora flower
    • One part of green peel (not peeled)
    • Five parts of cooked rehmannia
    • Five parts of angelica root

    Crush all ingredients to make one dose, using one cup of water. Boil to about seven-tenths, strain, and take warm.[153p]

    　　白朮安胃散　治一切泻痢，无问脓血相杂，里急窘痛，日夜无度。　　五味子　乌梅肉炒干，各五钱　车前子　茯苓　白朮各一两　米壳三两，去顶蒂穰，酢煮一宿，炒干　　右为末，每服五钱，水一盏半，煎至一盏，去滓，空心温服。

    Baizhu Anwei Powder: This treats all types of diarrhea and dysentery, regardless of whether there is mixed pus and blood, with abdominal urgency and pain, day and night without respite.

    Ingredients: 5 qian (a unit of weight) of Schisandra berries, dried black plum pulp; 1 liang (a unit of weight) each of Plantago seeds, Poria, and Atractylodes; 3 liang of rice husks (removing the tops), boiled in vinegar overnight and then dried.

    Preparation: Grind the ingredients into a fine powder. Each dose is 5 qian, mixed with 1.5 bowls of water, boiled down to 1 bowl, strained, and taken warm on an empty stomach.

    Sheng Bingzi: This treats red and white diarrhea, particularly when there is persistent pain in the lower abdomen that does not heal.

    Ingredients: 2 qian of yellow lead, 3 qian each of fine powder, imported sulfur, and Mithridatium powder; a small amount of light powder.

    Preparation: Grind into fine powder and mix with 4 qian of white flour. Add enough water to make a paste the size of a fingertip, shape into small cakes, and dry in the shade. Take with warm water before meals. Black stool indicates efficacy.

    Danggui He Xue Powder: This treats bloody diarrhea due to intestinal necrosis and damp-heat causing blood loss.

    Ingredients: 4 fen (a smaller unit of weight) of Chuanxiong, 6 fen each of Qingpi, Sophora flower, Schizonepeta spike, prepared Rehmannia, and Atractylodes; 1 qian each of Danggui and Cimicifuga.

    Preparation: Grind into a fine powder. Each dose is 2-3 qian, mixed with rice soup to be taken before meals.

    He Li Le Pill: This treats severe dysentery with uncontrollable symptoms day and night, with a strong foul odor that is intolerable, along with abdominal pain, where other medications have proven ineffective.

    Ingredients: 5 qian of He Zi flesh, 1 liang of the white skin of the Chinese ash tree root, and 30 pieces of mother clove.

    Preparation: Grind into a fine powder, mix with vinegar to form pills the size of sweet gum seeds. Each dose is 50 pills, taken with rice soup mixed with a little vinegar, consumed before dawn. Take three doses over three days for effectiveness.[154p]

    Hezi Skin Powder: Treats cold and slippery conditions, and diarrhea with red and white discharge.

    Take rice husks without stems and calyx, honey-fried; dried tangerine peel, each five parts; dry ginger, six parts; hezi, pounded and pit removed, seven parts. Mix into a fine powder for one dose, with two cups of water, decoct to one cup, and take warm on an empty stomach.

    Yizhi Hezhong Decoction: Treats intestinal bleeding with symptoms including blood that is dark purple, abdominal pain, aversion to cold on the skin, and a wiry pulse in the right hand, which is weak but favors warmth; indicating internal cold.

    Ingredients include one part cinnamon, four parts cinnamon twig, five parts each of peony root, bupleurum, kudzu root, yizhi nut, and pinellia; ten grams each of prepared licorice, astragalus, and aboveground part of levisticum; fifteen grams of white peony root; and a small amount of dry ginger. Mix into a coarse powder for one dose, with three cups of water, decoct to one cup, remove the dregs, and take warm after meals.

    Sophora Flower Powder: Also known as Angelica Blood Activating Decoction, treats intestinal bleeding due to damp-heat toxins.

    Ingredients include four parts chuanxiong, six parts each of sophora flowers, green citrus peel, schizonepeta spike, and cooked rehmannia; ten grams each of angelica root and aboveground part of levisticum. Mix into a fine powder, take three grams each time, adjusting with rice drink and decocting before meals. Avoid alcohol and damp, cold, hard foods.[155p]

    　　茯苓汤　治因伤冷饭水泄，日夜走十行，变作白痢。次日，其痢赤白，腹中(疒丂)痛，减食热躁，四肢沉困无力。　　泽泻一钱　黄芩生三分　当归身四分　肉桂　炙甘草各五分　猪苓　茯苓各六分　苍朮　生姜　升麻　柴胡各二钱　芍药一钱半　　右(口父)咀如麻豆大。分作二服，每服水二盏，煎至一盏，去柤稍热，食前服之。
    　　黑圆子 【《济生方》，下同】 　治脾胃怯弱，饮食过伤，留滞不化，遂成滞下，宜速进此药推导。更须斟酌受病深浅，增损圆数，还当逐尽积滞方佳，却徐徐补养之。　　乌梅七个　百草霜三钱　杏仁去皮尖，三七枚　巴豆去壳并油，二枚　半夏汤泡七次，九枚　缩砂仁三七枚　　右为细末和匀，用薄糊为圆如黍米大，每服十五圆加至二十圆，用熟水送，姜汤亦得。更看虚实，增损圆数。或因食生冷鱼脍得病，用治中汤送下亦可。恐此药仓卒不能办，止用局方感应圆少加巴豆为圆，服之亦佳。[156p]

    Fuling Decoction: This treats diarrhea caused by consuming cold rice, with persistent daily bowel movements resembling white diarrhea.     Black Round Pills: This treats weakness of the spleen and stomach due to excessive intake, leading to retention and stagnation. Administer promptly to help expel the stagnation.     Xiangrong Pills: Treats severe diarrhea.

    Ingredients: half a coin's worth of musk, ground separately and added to deer antler (deer velvet) that has been burned to remove hair and fat, roasted; one tael of fine deer antler powder, combined with musk to form balls the size of a Chinese parasol seed. Take fifty balls before meals on an empty stomach, using rice wine to swallow. If you add half a tael of milk musk to each dose, it is even more effective.

    Qian Gen Pills: Treats all forms of poisonous diarrhea and toxic dysentery, with bloody stools resembling chicken liver, mental distress, and abdominal pain.

    Ingredients: Qian gen (rubia), Sheng ma, rhinoceros horn, Di yu (sanguisorba), Bai Shao (white peony), Dang gui (angelica) without its husk, Huang lian (coptis) without its beard, Zhi ke (bitter orange) without the pulp, roasted flour. All are ground into fine powder, then boiled with rice paste to form balls the size of a Chinese parasol seed. Take seventy balls before meals on an empty stomach, using rice wine to swallow.

    Mu Xiang Bing Lang Pills: Treats dysentery.

    Ingredients: Mu xiang (costus), Bing lang (betel nut), Qing pi (green tangerine peel), Chen pi (aged tangerine peel), Guang bai zhu (large white atractylodes), Zhi ke (bitter orange), Huang lian (coptis), Huang bo (phellodendron), and Da huang (rhubarb), each half a tael. Stir-fried and powdered, with Xiang fu (cyperus) and Chou mo (costus) each two taels. The mixture is made into pills the size of a Chinese parasol seed. Take fifty to sixty pills with warm water, adjusting the dosage based on the patient's condition. "Gan Zhu" document mentions adding San leng (sparganium) and Huang qin (scutellaria) to differentiate the two formulas.[158p]

    Tiao Wei Cheng Qi Decoction: Treats accumulated stagnation causing dysentery.

    Half a pound of Glauber's salt, prepared licorice (two taels), and four taels of rhubarb, peeled and washed with wine, grind each to a powder.     He Zhong Pill: Treats the previous condition.

    Water Boiled Wood Fragrance Paste: Treats dampness in the spleen and stomach, causing slippery discharge, abdominal pain, frequent occurrences day and night, noise of water in the intestines, lack of appetite, urgency before diarrhea, heaviness afterwards, or passing of red and white discharge, and blood and pus in stool.

    Six taels of corn husk soaked in honey water and roasted until golden, one and a half taels each of frankincense and nutmeg, cardamom, angelica, white peony, wood fragrance, clove, nutmeg skin, patchouli, coptis, and magnolia, prepared with ginger juice, with prepared licorice, green tangerine peel, and dried tangerine peel each one tael, and half a tael each of dried ginger and bitter orange toasted with flour.

    滞下门

    　　　　方

    　　导滞汤 【《入门》，下同】 　治下痢脓血，里急后重，腹痛作渴，日夜无度。　　芍药一钱　当归　黄芩　黄连各五分　木香　槟榔　甘草各二分　大黄三分　肉桂二分半　　右，水煎服。一方无肉桂、甘草，有枳壳。大要以芍药、甘草和中止腹痛。恶热痛加黄芩，恶寒痛加姜、桂。以木香、槟榔行气，除后重。气分加枳壳、滑石宽肠，血分加当归、桃仁和血，以秦艽、皂子祛肠风，黄芩、黄连清热毒，白朮、陈皮调胃，茯苓、泽泻渗湿，山栀、枳实消积。呕吐加石膏、陈皮、山栀、姜汁。痢已后重不解，去槟、枳，换条芩，加升麻提之。虚者减芩、连、大黄，气虚加白朮、黄芪、砂仁，血虚加芎、归、阿胶、侧柏叶、炒干姜。此方行血和气，深合经旨。

    　　黄连五两　粉草二两[160p]

    Collection of Ancient and Modern Texts on Medicine, Volume 262

    Stagnation at the Lower Gate

    Formulas

    Guide to Stagnation Decoction - For treating dysentery with purulent blood, urgency in the abdomen, abdominal pain and thirst, with no regulation day or night.
    Ingredients:

    • 1 qian of Peony
    • 5 fen of Angelica
    • 5 fen of Scutellaria
    • 5 fen of Coptis
    • 2 fen of Aromatic Wood
    • 2 fen of Areca Nut
    • 2 fen of Licorice
    • 3 fen of Rhubarb
    • 2.5 fen of Cinnamon

    Prepare by boiling in water. An alternative formulation excludes Cinnamon and Licorice, substituting with Bitter Orange. The key is to use Peony and Licorice to alleviate abdominal pain. If there is heat with pain, add Scutellaria; if there is cold with pain, add Ginger or Cinnamon. Use Aromatic Wood and Areca Nut to move Qi and relieve heaviness in the lower abdomen. For issues in the Qi aspect, add Bitter Orange and Talcum for wider intestines; for blood issues, add Angelica and Peach Kernel to harmonize the blood. Use Gentian and Soapberry to expel intestinal wind, while Scutellaria and Coptis clear heat and toxins. White Atractylodes and Aged Tangerine Peel harmonize the stomach; Poria and Alisma drain dampness; Gardenia and Bitter Orange relieve accumulation. If vomiting occurs, add Gypsum, Aged Tangerine Peel, Gardenia, and Ginger Juice. If after dysentery the heaviness persists, remove Areca and Bitter Orange, switch to Scutellaria, and add Lonicera to lift it. For those with deficiency, reduce Scutellaria, Coptis, and Rhubarb; for Qi deficiency, add White Atractylodes, Astragalus, and Sand Ginger; for blood deficiency, add Chuang, Angelica, Donkey-hide Gel, Cedar Leaf, and Dry Ginger. This formula promotes blood circulation and harmonizes Qi, deeply in line with the principles of the classics.

    Aromatic Coptis Pills - For treating all types of dysentery.
    Ingredients:

    • 5 liang of Coptis
    • 2 liang of powdered Licorice[160p]

    Liushen Pills: For treating dysentery.

    Jiami Qingliu Wan is used to treat persistent dysentery. The discharge resembles clear mucus and may contain purple-black blood streaks. Causes include overeating, excessive movement, shouting loudly, physical blows resulting in pain, and intense anger that is not released, leading to excessive blockage, while fire, alcohol, and meat contribute to blood stagnation.

    Ingredients:

    Ganying Wan treats adults and children for stagnant food accumulation, where cold items can't be digested, causing damage to the spleen and stomach, leading to foul-smelling diarrhea, or dysentery with purulent blood, along with abdominal heat and pain.

    Ingredients:

    • 1 liang each of herbal frost, clove, and dry ginger
    • 72 pieces of Ba frost
    • 49 apricot kernels
    • 21 nutmeg seeds
    • 2 liang of wood fragrance.

    Grind the above into a fine powder, use yellow wax to filter out impurities, and melt it in wine. Collect the floating portion, about 4 liang, and depending on the season, use 1 liang of clean oil in spring and summer or 1.5 liang in autumn and winter. Heat it, mix in the previous wax until melted, then allow to cool. Take the previous powder and blend well, wrap in oiled paper, and form pills the size of walnuts. For children, make them the size of small beans, taking 20 pills with plain rice soup or ginger soup. One variation may include yellow lead and frankincense.[162p]

    Roasted millet husks without coarse skin, soaked in ginger juice overnight, then dry-fried.
    Grind into powder; 2 Qian mixed with rice drink for administration. One dose induces bowel movement; a second dose will cure. Avoid raw, cold, oily, or toxic fish and pickles for three days. One variation includes equal parts thick bark and ginger.

    Chuan Jin Dan: This treats adults and children for all types of diarrhea and dysentery, regardless of heat or cold, red or white, continuous and recurrent, or accompanied by abdominal pain. It is advisable to take this remedy.

    Charming Song for Treating Dysentery:
    "When dysentery reaches its climax, the situation may be perilous, the wondrous formula evenly shared among doctors. The three fragrances that relieve pain are most essential; four whites harmonize the center and must not be lacking. Add sweet orange peel with poppy husks; rely entirely on pomegranate skin with he zi (fragrant fruit). Ban Xia (Pinellia), Hou Po (Magnolia Bark), Huang Lian (Coptis), and Ju Pi (tangerine peel) – the heavenly doctors save distress in mere moments."

    Ingredients:

    • Ding Xiang (Clove) - 1 qian
    • Chen Xiang (Agarwood) - 1 qian
    • Mu Xiang (Aucklandia) - 1 qian
    • Bai Zhu (Atractylodes) - 1 qian
    • Bai Zhi (Angelica Dahurica) - 1 qian

    • Di Yu (Sanguisorba) - 1 qian

    • Chen Pi (Tangerine Peel) - 1 qian

    Divide these into five doses. Add fresh ginger for the white decoction and black plum for the red decoction, to be taken before meals. This treats all forms of diarrhea and dysentery, relieving long-standing abdominal pain.[167p]

    　　断痢散

    Duanli San
    Mace, dried ginger, and clove: 2.5 qian each. Remove the pits from the haritaki fruit. Honey-fried licorice, and aged tangerine peel: 1 liang each. Fried millet husk (remove stems) with honey: 3 liang. Grind the ingredients, take 2.5 qian with one cup of water, one particle of olibanum, and a hundred grains of millet. Boil until reduced to seven parts, strain, and take warm before meals. For cholera with vomiting and diarrhea, take cold.

    Liushen San
    Used for treating red and white diarrhea, unbearable abdominal pain, and chronic dysentery. Honey-fried millet husk: 1 liang. Green peel, aged tangerine peel, black plum flesh, and dried ginger each: 5 qian. Honey-fried licorice: 3 qian. Grind the ingredients, take 4 qian with one and a half cups of water, one particle of olibanum, and boil until reduced to six parts, strain, and take warm before meals, three times a day. One version without olibanum. Take cold for red dysentery, hot for white dysentery, and warm for mixed dysentery. One version without dried ginger.

    Ru Sheng San
    Treats all types of dysentery, regardless of duration or whether red, white, or mixed. Effective day and night without limits. Angelica, ground earth, cardamom, red stone resin, aged tangerine peel, dried ginger, pomegranate peel, haritaki flesh, poppy husk, and licorice in equal parts. Grind coarsely, take 3 qian with one and a half cups of water, add one aged plum, and boil until reduced to seven parts, then strain. Take cold for red dysentery, hot for white dysentery, and warm for mixed dysentery. Suitable for elderly, pregnant women, and children. Avoid raw, cold, and greasy foods.[168p]

    Purgative Myrrh Powder

    Ingredients:

    • 1 ounce of white plum
    • 1 ounce of jujube
    • 1 ounce of poppy capsule
    • 0.5 ounce of dried myrobalan (ash)

    Preparation: Grind these into a coarse powder. For each dose, take 1-2 qian (Chinese weight), mix with a small cup of water, add a small bean-sized amount of myrrh, and decoct until reduced to 70%. Take warm, without regard to time.

    Miraculous Efficacy Powder
    For various types of dysentery, whether red or white, or mixed in severity; for inner urgency and heavy feelings in the lower abdomen, with pain around the navel, or passing five colors, or resembling fish brain, with indiscriminate frequency day and night; for when one cannot eat, whether for adults or children, the weak elderly or postpartum women, it is suitable for all.

    Ingredients:

    • 2 ounces of angelica root (washed)
    • 2 ounces of licorice (roasted)
    • 2 ounces of roasted rice husk (removed from the cap)
    • 5 qian (Chinese weight) of red peony root
    • 5 qian of ground earth (sanguisorba)
    • 5 qian of sour pomegranate skin

    Preparation: Grind these into a coarse powder. For each dose, take 3 qian, mix with 1.5 cups of water, and decoct until reduced to 70%; take warm on an empty stomach. Children's doses should be adjusted according to age. Avoid raw, cold, oily, and greasy foods. One variant includes red tuckahoe and northern jujubes in equal parts.

    Holy Jujube
    Treats all forms of diarrhea, alleviates abdominal pain.[169p]

    Recipe for a Healing Powder

    Two and a half qian of wood fragrance, separately ground frankincense, and myrrh, each one qian. Two pieces of nutmeg, wrapped and cooked. The right side is to be powdered. For each dose, take one qian, with one large dry jujube, pitted. First, put half the medicine inside the jujube, then soak half a grain of croton seed in water, followed by adding half a qian of powdered medicine. Form into a cake wrapped in oil dough, about a finger thick. Cook over fire until the dough is done, then remove the dough and discard the croton seed, chewing the medicine finely, with rice drink, taken on an empty stomach.

    An alternative method uses one tael of powdered frankincense and two taels of processed nutmeg ball, combined with aged rice paste to make pills.

    True Formula of Divine Powder treats men and women suffering from dampness affecting the spleen and stomach, with cold settling in the middle, frequent injury from eating, fullness and heaviness in the chest, swelling in the sides, gurgling intestines, tightness and pain in the lower abdomen, urgency below the navel, irregular bowel movements, sluggish digestion of grains, feelings of urgency and heaviness, diarrhea with pus and blood, or with five colors, or resembling fish eyes, or bean juice, or fresh blood, or resembling rotten meat, often without restraint, enduring for a long time, lethargy, weakness, heavy limbs, and fluctuating chills and fevers. This medicine can strengthen and nourish the spleen and stomach, warm the center, and alleviate abdominal pain; its use brings significant benefits.

    Ingredients:

    • Haritaki peel
    • Dried ginger, roasted
    • Cloves
    • Nutmeg, wrapped and cooked
    • Scomber fish bones, skinned
    • Red stone resin
    • Licorice, roasted to yellow, each one tael
    • Five liang of millet husks, crushed and vinegar-fried

    The right side is to be finely powdered. For each dose, first take one cup of water, add a little frankincense, boil for five to seven minutes, then mix in two qian of the powdered medicine, and take it warm before meals.[170p]

    (Grass and tongue) Loosened seeds: Treats prolonged cases of five-colored dysentery that won’t heal. One loosened seed, the yellow type, is roasted over charcoal and stored; left underground overnight, it releases its toxins. Grind it into a fine powder, take one dose, and mix it with warm wine. Hu Daqing had a servant suffering from dysentery for two years and, upon meeting a Daoist in Hangzhou, was cured using this formula.

    Stop Dysentery Method: One meat nutmeg, two hard resins (remove the pits). Grind into a powder; take one qian (a unit of weight), and mix it with rice drink on an empty stomach.

    Hundred-Year Pill: Treats all evil forms of dysentery, mixed cases of red and white, as well as rest-related dysentery. One large woolly seed, five qian each of ephedra, powdered angelica, poppy husk, and yellow bile (coptis chinensis). A small amount of frankincense ground separately. Except for the frankincense, cut the remaining herbs into small pieces, fry until dark brown while preventing smoke; grind into a powder, mix with frankincense, and knead into pills about the size of a phoenix seed. Take one pill per year, ten pills at ten years, following the age for consumption without strict timing, swallowed with rice drink.

Divide into two doses, add 2 cups of water, 100 black beans, 5 slices of fresh ginger, and 1 white plum. Boil until it's down to 1 cup, strain, and take warm before meals.

    　　还真散　治毒痢初得时，先发寒热，服前方，寒热已退，赤痢已消减，宜进此还真散。若服前方，寒热未退，赤痢未消减，更不宜进此药。　　诃子五个，用面裹火焙熟，不要生，亦不要焦，去面不用，就热咬破诃子，去核不用，只用皮焙干　　右捣罗为细末，每服二钱匕，以米汤一盏半，同药炼取一盏，空心和滓吃。若吐出一两口涎更佳。如此吃经数盏，大腑渐安，出后减少，修合第三方药吃，以牢固大肠。若吃前方药，壮热未退，血痢未减，不可进此药。[174p]

    Yangzi's Method for Complete Protection of Life

    For the initial treatment of dysentery, if there is first the onset of chills and fever with a headache, and blood changes in the middle leading to frequent bouts of red dysentery, the following formula is prescribed:

    • Xi Xin (Asarum) 8 drachmas
    • Qian Niu (Wrapped in cloth, baked until cooked) 4 drachmas
    • Ma Huang (Ephedra) 3 parts
    • Guan Gui (Cinnamon twig) 3 parts
    • Xiong Dan (Sichuan lovage) 2 taels
    • Bai Zhu (Atractylodes) 2 taels
    • Gao Ben (Ligusticum) 5 qian
    • Du Huo (Angelica) 5 qian
    • Jie Geng (Platycodon) 5 qian
    • Fang Feng (Siler) 5 qian
    • Bai Shao (White peony) 5 qian
    • Bai Zhi (Angelica dahurica) 5 qian
    • Dan Pi (Moutan) 1 part
    • Gan Cao (Licorice) 1 part

    Machinate these into a fine powder. Every dose is 2 qian, taken with warm soup prepared outside of meal times, and consume alongside the dregs to counteract heat. If, after two or three doses, the chills and fever persist, the subsequent prescription should be used.

    Huan Zhen Powder

    For the treatment of toxic dysentery when first onset includes chills and fever, take the previously mentioned formula. Once the chills and fever have subdued and the red dysentery has decreased, then this Huan Zhen Powder should be introduced. However, if the chills and fever do not recede and the red dysentery continues, do not take this medicine.

    Five He Zi (Terminalia) should be wrapped in flour and baked until cooked; they should not be raw or burnt. Remove the flour and while still hot, bite through the He Zi, discarding the pit but retaining the skin and drying it out.

    Crush and sieve into a fine powder. For each dose, take 2 qian and mix it with 1.5 bowls of rice soup, reducing it to 1 bowl. Consume on an empty stomach with the dregs. If one expectorates a bit of saliva, that is even better. After taking several doses, the large intestine will gradually calm down, and upon evacuation, reduce further consumption. Follow up with the third medicinal approach to consolidate the large intestine. If the previous medicine has not reduced the intense heat and bloody dysentery, do not take this medicine.[174p]

    　　十宝汤　治冷痢如鱼脑者三服见效，甚疾。　　黄芪四两　熟地黄酒浸　白茯苓　当归酒浸　人参　白朮炒　制半夏　白芍药炒　五味子　官桂各一两　甘草五钱　　右为粗末，每服二钱，水一盏，生姜三片，乌梅一个，煎至七分，食前温服。
    　　外炙膏　治一切虚寒，下痢赤白，或时腹痛，肠滑不禁，心腹冷极，皆可用。　　木香　附子炮　蛇床子　吴茱萸　胡椒　川乌各等分　　右为细末，每药末三钱，用面二钱，用生姜自然汁调作糊，贴脐中，上下以衣物盖定，熨斗盛火熨之，痢止为度。

    Shibao Soup: Treats cold dysentery like fish brain; three doses will show effect, very quick.

    • 4 taels of Huangqi
    • Cooked Dihuang soaked in yellow wine
    • Bai Fuling
    • Danggui soaked in wine
    • Ren Shen
    • Bai Zhu roasted
    • Zhi Banxia
    • Bai Shaoyao roasted

    • 5 qian of Gan Cao

    Grind the above into a coarse powder. For each dose, take 2 qian, add to 1 cup of water, with 3 slices of fresh ginger and 1 dried ume. Boil until reduced to seven parts, then take warm before meals.

    External Heating Ointment: Treats all kinds of cold deficiency, dysentery with red and white discharge, occasional abdominal pain, uncontrollable bowel movement, extreme cold in the heart and abdomen, all can be used.

    • Muxiang
    • Fuzi processed
    • Shechuangzi
    • Wuzhuyu
    • Huojiao
    • Chuanwu, all in equal parts

    Grind the above into a fine powder. For each dose, take 3 qian of the powder, mix with 2 qian of flour, and use fresh ginger juice to make a paste. Apply to the navel and cover with clothing, then use a hot iron to heat until the dysentery stops.

    Wushen Powder: Treats cold accumulation in the large intestine, persistent dysentery, urgent abdominal pressure, and pain.

    • Fuzi processed, skin removed
    • Dried ume with pits removed, each 5 qian
    • Dried ginger processed
    • Clerodendron with pits removed
    • Yanhusuo, each 1 tael

    Grind the above into a coarse powder, mix with white flour, wrap and roast on slow heat until the flour is cooked, then remove and dry to a fine powder. For each dose, take 1 qian, and drink it with rice water before meals on an empty stomach.[175p]

    Huangqi powder treats heat dysentery with symptoms of red and yellow pus-blood, abdominal pain, and irritability. It consists of three parts each of Huangqi, dragon bone, and angelica, one liang of slightly roasted Huanglian, five qian each of Huangbo, Huangqin, rhino horn shavings, and Dihu, and two fen of raw Dihu. This mixture is to be ground finely; each dose is two qian, taken at any time, mixed with congee for consumption.

    Xijiao powder treats heat dysentery causing red and yellow pus-blood, abdominal pain, and distress and discomfort. It is made from one liang each of rhino horn shavings, slightly roasted Huanglian, Dihu, Huangqi, five qian of fried angelica, and three fen of muxiang. This is prepared as a powder; each dose is two qian, boiled with a cup of water until reduced to six parts, filtered, and can be taken warm at any time.

    Huanglian pill, also known as antelope horn pill, treats all forms of heat dysentery and lingering dysentery, occurring frequently day and night, and is also effective against dark blood resembling chicken liver color. It contains two and a half liang of Huanglian, one and a half liang each of antelope horn powder and Huangbo, and five qian of red poria. This is ground into a fine powder, mixed with honey to form pills the size of a phoenix nut. Each dose is twenty pills, taken with ginger honey drink.

    Shengdi Huang decoction treats persistent heat dysentery.[176p]

    　　生地黄半两　地榆三分　甘草炙一分　　右(口父)咀如麻豆大，用水二盏，煎至一盏，去滓，分作二服，空心日晚温服。

    　　如圣汤　治下痢赤白甚重者。

    Formula for Treatment of Dysentery

    Ingredients:

    • 0.5 taels of raw Rehmannia
    • 0.3 taels of ground Phellodendron bark
    • 0.1 taels of roasted licorice

    Preparation:
    Grind the above ingredients to the size of mung beans. Use two cups of water to simmer until reduced to one cup. Strain, divide into two doses, and take warm on an empty stomach in the evening.

    Yujin Powder
    Used for all heat toxins and dysentery with persistent blood discharge.

    • 0.5 taels of Yujin (Turmeric)
    • 0.5 taels of prepared Sophora flower
    • 0.1 taels of roasted licorice

    Preparation:
    Grind to a fine powder. Take 1 to 2 qian before meals, mixed with fermented soybean broth.

    Ruh Sheng Decoction
    Used for severe red and white dysentery.

    • 3 inches of ginseng and Angelica
    • 1 piece of myrrh, about the size of a black bean
    • 2 inches of roasted licorice
    • 7 pieces of large north jujube
    • 7 pieces of black plum
    • 21 each of white cardamom and poppy seeds (husk removed, honey-roasted)
    • 21 each of sand ginger and large cloves
    • 2 pieces of ginger wrapped in wet paper and steamed

    Preparation:
    Grind the above ingredients to powder, divide into three doses. Use one and a half cups of water, simmer until reduced to seven-tenths of a cup, strain and consume. It is also acceptable to omit the poppy husk.

    Mugwort Leaf Pills
    Used for severe red and white dysentery with excessive bleeding and intolerable pain.

    • 0.3 taels of roasted mugwort
    • 0.3 taels of roasted Coptis
    • 0.3 taels of wood incense (half of each roasted and raw)
    • 1 tael of ground Phellodendron
    • 0.5 taels of roasted and dried donkey-hide gelatin
    • 0.5 taels of sliced and toasted Angelica
    • 0.3 taels of nutmeg

    Preparation:
    Grind the above to a fine powder, form into pills the size of a wutong seed. Take 30 pills with rice drink.

    Red and White Dysentery Recipe
    Verse:
    Three slices of ginger, three jujubes, one black plum, three inches of grass,
    Add poppy seeds and dried tangerine peel, all together to sweep away dysentery.[177p]

    An He Yin Zi treats both red and white dysentery, regardless of age. Use 2.5 qian each of poppy husk and wood fragrance, and 1 qian each of roasted licorice and ground earth elm. Grind these into a fine powder. The dosage is 3 qian per serving, mixed with rice drink to be taken.

    Yu Bao Du treats all forms of deficiency-cold dysentery, red or white, as well as abdominal pain, loose intestines, and extreme cold in the stomach. For this, use 4 liang of qian sha, stir-fried, 5 qian of white alum, and 1 liang of official cinnamon. Grind these into a powder, mix them uniformly to form a pouch, and dissolve in cold water. Apply the paste on the skin over the abdomen, and secure it with cloth. If feeling very hot, cover it with clothing. When the medicine dries, rewet it to maintain warmth. This can be used three to four times.

    Ruan Hong Wan eliminates deficiency and accumulations, and treats imbalanced heat and cold, as well as red and white dysentery mixed with pus and blood. Separate grind 1 piece of frankincense the size of a jujube, 1 piece of myrrh the same size, 2 scorpions (remove toxins), 49 pieces of Siao Sui Zi (remove skins), along with powdered frost and yellow lead separately ground. Use 5 qian each of yellow wax, and 1 qian of red cinnabar, all ground separately. Remove the skins from 20 pieces of wild castor seeds, but do not remove the oil, and grind into a paste. Mix these powders uniformly, melt the wax in ceramic until it becomes fluid, then add about half a teaspoon of sesame oil, and finally mix in the medicine to form pills the size of mung beans, reserving half of the red cinnabar for the coating. The dosage for adults is 20 pills, taken with frankincense decoction. For children, make the pills the size of yellow millet, taking one pill each time with frankincense decoction before meals.[178p]

    Cinnamon Pill: Treats white dysentery and abdominal pain.
    Wrap and cook some nutmeg, wrap and cook some cardamom, crushed sand ginger, and the hairless tips of loquat leaves, each weighing one tael; two taels of earth rhubarb; five qian each of costus, agarwood, and ground Beijing ink.
    Make a fine powder, mix with millet rice to form pills the size of cherries. Take two pills before meals, dissolved in rice drink.

    Mica Powder: Treats chronic dysentery that does not heal over the years.
    Mix three fen each of mica powder, white poria, and processed aconite (removing skin and navel); half a tael each of red stone resin and dragon bone.
    Make a fine powder, take two qian before meals, mixed with warm wine or rice drink; also treats bloody dysentery.

    Golden Star Eel Powder: Treats chronic dysentery.
    Use five taels each of golden star eel, vinegar-fried alum, and lead oxide.[179p]

    The following are powdered remedies. Take two qian before meals, mixed with rice wine.

    Wu Ti Pill: Treats chronic dysentery that does not heal, along with worms and rectal prolapse.
    Ingredients: Stir-fried Wu Ti, Huanglian (with beards removed), each two liang; Snake bile five qian.
    Grind to a fine powder, mix with honey to form pills the size of Paeonia seeds. Take thirty pills before meals, washed down with apricot kernel soup.

    Xiang Su San: Treats chronic new dysentery.
    Ingredients: Stir-fried poppy husk, two liang; Mu Xiang, Di Yu, Chen Pi (retain the white part), stir-fried dried ginger, honey-fried licorice, each five qian.
    Grind to a coarse powder, take three qian, with one and a half cups of water and one date, boil until reduced to one cup, strain, and drink warm before meals.

    Wu Qi Decoction: Treats chronic dysentery, regardless of whether it's red or white, it treats both.
    Ingredients: Two He Zi—one raw and one roasted in flour, pit removed; nutmeg and cardamom, each two, prepared as above; Mu Xiang, the size of a jujube; licorice one inch long, roughly the size of a finger, roasted until red.
    Grind to a fine powder, take two qian at any time, using rice wine to wash it down.

    Mai Mian Pill: Treats resting dysentery where one cannot eat or drink and suffers from emaciation.
    Ingredients: Stir-fried barley flour, Fu Zi, roasted, peeled and split; white Poria, Guang Gui, stir-fried Chen Qu, stir-fried Wu Mei meat, ginseng, each one liang.
    Grind to a fine powder, mix with honey to form pills the size of Paeonia seeds. Take thirty pills, boiled with jujube meat soup, at any time. There is also a method for making batch dough pills on the seventh day of the seventh month.[180p]

    Fu Ling Decoction: For the treatment of generalized edema after dysentery.
    Ingredients: Red Fu Ling, fried Bai Zhu, lightly fried Ze Qi Ye, each one tael; Fang Ji, roasted white root of mulberry, Huang Qin, She Gan, and Ze Xie, each three taels.
    Preparation: Grind the above. Each dose is five qian (money), first boil three cups of water with one half cup of soybeans, reduce to two cups, strain, add the herbs, and boil down to one cup. Divide into two doses. If not healed, take frequently.

    Xiao Pi Wan: For the treatment of fullness and bloating in the abdomen after dysentery.
    Ingredients: Aged tangerine peel, white removed; green tangerine peel, white removed, both one tael; Mu Xiang two qian; Cang Zhu soaked and roasted, four taels.
    Preparation: Grind into powder, make into pills the size of a phoenix seed with vinegar. Each dose is twenty pills, taken on an empty stomach with warm wine. For children, three to seven pills with rice soup.

    Zhu Gan Wan: For the treatment of weak spleen and stomach after dysentery, with loss of appetite and weak limbs.
    Ingredients: One large leaf of pig liver, boiled with vinegar until soft and ground into a paste; lightly fried Wu Mei; dry ginger roasted; grass cardamom seeds; lightly fried Dang Gui; nutmeg; thick skin with ginger juice roasted; Keli fruit stewed; and Piper vine seeds, each one tael; and one part of licorice, lightly roasted; and five qian of cinnamon heart.
    Preparation: Grind into powder, mix with the pig liver, and form pills the size of a phoenix seed. Each dose is twenty pills, taken at any time with congee.[181p]

    Canglin Tang: Treats rigid mouth diarrhea with heat, characterized by toxic gas disturbing the heart, causing immediate vomiting after eating. Ingredients: ginseng, poria, honey-fried licorice, prepared pinellia, Sichuan pepper, qinghua, ligusticum, balloon flower, bupleurum, bitter orange, and aged grain rice, all in equal parts. Grind and take five qian, with one and a half bowls of water, three slices of fresh ginger, decoct until reduced to seven parts, strain, and take warm at any time.

    Shenling Baizhu Powder: Treats stomach deficiency and rigid mouth. Ingredients: ginseng, poria, white atractylodes, white hyacinth beans (soaked in ginger juice and stir-fried, skins removed), yam, lotus seeds, reduced sand cardamom, and roasted coix seeds, all two taels each. Grind into a fine powder, and take with decocted acorus calamus soup. Eating raw chives is advisable.

    Tongshen Pill: Treats purulent blood diarrhea with heavy pain and prolonged illness. Ingredients: five-spice resin (sand removed and ground), myrrh, frankincense, each one qian, and five fen of croton seed powder. Grind together, add water to form pills about the size of yellow millet, taking seven pills each time. Decoct fresh papaya soup before eating. For children, take three pills, adjusting according to age.[182p]

    　　右等分为末，每服二钱，蜜汤调下，米饮亦得。
    　　白朮圣散子　治一切泻痢久不瘥，并妇人产后痢。　　当归　肉豆蔻　砂仁　石榴皮　诃子肉　陈皮　干姜炮　甘草　白朮　芍药　　右各等分(口父)咀，每服五钱，水二盏，入乳香一豆许，煎至一盏，去滓，食前温服。
    　　下痢方 【《正传》，下同】 　治久痢已数日，不能起床，不食，疲弱之甚者。　　御米壳酢炒，二分　人参　黄芪　地榆　砂仁　泽泻各半钱　白朮　芍药　陈皮各一钱　当归七分　木香　炙甘草　升麻　白蔻各三分　　右细切，作一服，水一盏半，煎至一盏，去柤温服。
    　　经验三根饮　治休息痢，年久不愈者，其效如神。　　五倍木根　苍耳草根　臭樗木根白皮各等分　　右细切，每七钱，生姜三片，大枣一枚，大黑豆三十六粒，糯米四十九粒，水二盏，煎至一盏，去柤温服。[183p]

    Sanqi San: Treats post-diarrhea urgency and heaviness.
    Ingredients: Bitter Orange Peel, Astragalus, Siler.
    Take these in equal parts, grind to a powder, and take two qian mixed with honeyed water or rice drink.

    Baizhu Shengsanzi: Treats any long-term diarrhea and postpartum diarrhea in women.
    Ingredients: Angelica, Nutmeg, Amomum, Pomegranate Peel, Myrobalan flesh, Tangerine Peel, Dry Ginger, Licorice, Atractylodes, Peony.
    Mix these in equal parts, chew, take five qian with two bowls of water, add a small amount of Frankincense, and boil until reduced to one bowl, then strain and take warm before meals.

    Diarrhea Formula:
    For prolonged diarrhea lasting several days, inability to rise, no appetite, and extreme weakness.
    Ingredients: Roasted Rice Husk (2 fen), Ginseng, Astragalus, Ground Dragon (Yiyu), Amomum, and Alisma (each 0.5 qian), Atractylodes, Peony, Tangerine Peel (each 1 qian), Angelica (7 fen), Wood Fragrance, Roasted Licorice, and Bupleurum (each 3 fen).
    Finely chop these to make one dose, using one and a half bowls of water, boil down to one bowl, strain, and take warm.

    Experience Three Roots Decoction: Treats chronic and recurrent diarrhea effectively.
    Ingredients: Fivefold Wood Root, Xanthium Root, and Stinking Ailanthus Root (each in equal parts).
    Finely chop these, take seven qian, add three slices of fresh ginger, one date, thirty-six black beans, forty-nine glutinous rice grains, and two bowls of water, boil down to one bowl, strain, and take warm.[183p]

    　　右归饮 【《景岳全书》，下同】 　此益火之剂也。凡痢疾命门之阳衰阴胜者，宜此方加减主之。　　熟地二三钱钱或加至一二两　杜仲姜制　枸杞　山药炒，各二钱　肉桂　甘草炙，各一二钱　制附子一二三钱　山茱萸一钱　　右，水二锺，煎七分，食远温服。

    　　加减一阴煎　治水亏火盛，宜用此方。　　生地　芍药　麦冬各二钱　熟地三五钱　炙甘草五七分　知母　地骨皮各一钱　　右，水二锺，煎服。

    　　赤金豆　治诸积不行，凡血凝气滞，疼痛肿胀，虫积结聚，症瘕泻利，宜此主之。　　巴霜去皮膜，略去油，一钱半　生附子切，略炒　皂角炒，各二钱　丁香　天竺黄　木香各三钱　轻粉一钱　　右为末，酢浸蒸饼，为丸萝卜子大，朱砂二钱为衣。欲渐去者，每服五七丸。欲骤行者，每服一二十丸。用滚水或煎药，或姜酢茶蜜茴香史君子煎汤，为引送下。若利多不止，可饮冷水一二口即止。盖此药得热则行，得冷则止也。[184p]

    Right Return Decoction
    This is a remedy that boosts fire. For any cases of dysentery where Yang is weak and Yin is strong, this formula should be adjusted for use.

    • Prepared Rehmannia: 2-3 qian or increased to 1-2 liang
    • Eucommia Bark: ginger processed,
    • Goji Berries:
    • Honey-fried Dioscorea: each 2 qian
    • Cinnamon:
    • Honey-fried Licorice: each 1-2 qian
    • Processed Aconite: 1-2-3 qian
    • Cornelian Cherry: 1 qian

    For the above, use 2 zhong of water, decoct until there are 7 parts left, and take warm after meals.

    Adjusted Yin Decoction
    For treating water deficiency and excess fire, this formula is appropriate.

    • Fresh Rehmannia:
    • Paeonia:
    • Ophiopogon: each 2 qian
    • Prepared Rehmannia: 3-5 qian
    • Honey-fried Licorice: 5-7 fen
    • Anemarrhena:
    • Rehmannia's root bark: each 1 qian

    For the above, use 2 zhong of water and decoct for consumption.

    Red Gold Bean
    This treats various accumulations that are stagnant. For any conditions involving blood coagulation, Qi stagnation, pain swelling, parasitic accumulation, symptoms of fullness, and diarrhea, this is to be utilized.

    • Remove the skin and film of Aconitum, reducing the oil: 1.5 qian
    • Fresh Aconite cut, lightly stir-fried
    • Soapberry, stir-fried: each 2 qian
    • Clove:
    • Gardenia:
    • Mu Xiang: each 3 qian
    • Light powder: 1 qian

    The above should be ground into a fine powder, soaked in vinegar, and made into pills the size of radish seeds, with 2 qian of cinnabar as a coating. For gradual passage, take 5-7 pills each time. For rapid passage, take 10-20 pills each time. Use boiling water or decocted medicine, or ginger vinegar tea with honey and fennel for guidance during administration. If diarrhea persists, drinking a few sips of cold water should suffice. This medicine operates with heat and ceases with cold.[184p]

    　　百顺丸　治一切阳邪积滞，痢疾泄泻。　　川大黄锦纹者，一斤　牙皂角炒微黄，一两六钱　　右为末，用汤浸蒸饼，捣丸菉豆大。每用五分或一钱，或二三钱，酌宜用引送下；或用蜜为丸亦可。
    　　保阴煎　治一切阴虚内热，痢疾动血等证。　　生地　熟地　芍药各二钱　山药　川续断　黄芩　黄蘗各一钱半　生甘草一钱　　水二锺，煎七分，食远温服。

    Bai Shun Pill: Treats all yang pathological accumulations, dysentery, and diarrhea.
    Coptis chinensis (Huang Jin Wen), one pound;
    Fried soapberry (Ya Zao Jiao), lightly yellow, one and a half taels.
    Grind them into powder, use with soup to soak steamed buns, and mold into the size of a large mung bean. Each time, use five fen or one qian, or two to three qian as needed, appropriately taken with some liquid; or made into pills with honey is also acceptable.

    Bao Yin Decoction: Treats all symptoms of yin deficiency and internal heat, and dysentery with blood.
    Raw Rehmannia, cooked Rehmannia, and Peony each two qian;
    Chinese Yam, Sichuan Dextroampelopsis, Huang Qin, Huang Bo each one and a half qian;
    Raw Liquorice one qian.
    Add two bowls of water, decoct to seven parts, and take warm after meals.

    Da Fen Qing Drink: Treats accumulated heat and blockages, obstructed urination, or causes severe pain in the lower back and abdomen, or damp-heat dysentery, jaundice with blood in urine, pathogenic heat engendering blood, abdominal pain, and urinary blockages.
    Poria, Alisma, and Akebia each two qian;
    Polyporus, Bitter Orange Peel, Gardenia (or double the amount), and Plantago seeds each one qian.
    Add one and a half bowls of water, decoct to eight parts, and take warm after meals.[185p]

    　　清流饮　治阴虚挟热，泻痢，或发热，或喜冷，或下纯红鲜血，或小水痛赤等证。　　生地黄　芍药　白茯苓　泽泻各二钱　枳壳　甘草各一钱　当归一二钱　黄芩　黄连各钱半　　水一锺半，煎服。

    Qingliu Drink: Treats yin deficiency with heat, dysentery, possibly with fever, prefers coolness, pure red fresh blood in stool, or painful urination with redness. Ingredients: 2 portions of raw Rehmannia, Peony, White Poria, and Alisma; 1 portion each of Bitter Orange and Licorice; 1-2 portions of Angelica; 0.5 portions each of Scutellaria and Coptis. Prepare with 1.5 pints of water and decoct.

    Liuwèi Huāngyáng Drink: Treats spleen and kidney deficiency with cold dysentery. Ingredients: 3 portions of Angelica; 1-2 taels or several portions of Ginseng; 1 portion of roasted Licorice; 2-3 portions each of prepared Aconite and dried Ginger; 5 portions or 1 tael of cooked Rehmannia. Prepare with 2 pints of water, boil with vigorous heat until reduced to 7-8 parts, and take warm.

    Liyin Decoction: This is a modified version of the Zhongtang formula. Treats spleen and kidney deficiency with dysentery. Ingredients: 3-5 portions or 1-2 taels of cooked Rehmannia; 2-3 portions or 5-7 portions of Angelica; 1-2 portions each of roasted Licorice and stir-fried Dried Ginger; optionally add 1-2 portions of Cinnamon. Prepare with 2 pints of water, decoct until reduced to 7-8 parts, and take hot.

    Wengwei Drink: Treats abdominal cold with vomiting, sour regurgitation, dysentery, and loss of appetite. Ingredients: 1-3 portions or 1 tael of Ginseng; 2-3 portions or 1 tael of stir-fried Atractylodes; 2 portions of stir-fried Hyacinth Bean; 1 portion each of roasted Licorice and aged Chenpi (tangerine peel, optional); 1-3 portions of stir-fried Dried Ginger; 1-2 portions of Angelica (omit if diarrhea occurs). Prepare with 2 pints of water, decoct until reduced to 7 parts, and take warm away from meals.[186p]

    　　五君子煎，治脾胃虚寒，呕吐泻痢而兼湿者。　　人参二三钱　白朮土炒　白茯苓各二钱　甘草炙，一钱　干姜炒黄，一二钱　　水一锺半，煎服。加陈皮一钱，名六味异功煎，治证同而兼微滞者。
    　　胃关煎　治脾肾，虚寒腹痛不止，冷痢等证。　　熟地三五钱或一两　山药炒　扁豆炒，各二钱　炙甘草一二钱　焦干姜　白朮炒，各一二三钱　吴茱萸制，五七分　　水二锺，煎七分，食远温服。

    　　佐关煎　治生冷伤脾，泻痢未久，肾气未损者，宜用此汤以去寒湿，安脾胃。此胃关煎之佐者也。　　厚朴炒　陈皮炒，各一钱　山药炒　扁豆炒　猪苓　泽泻各二钱　肉桂　干姜炒，各一二钱　炙甘草七分水一锺半，煎服。

    　　厚朴　陈皮　乌药各一钱五分　炙甘草一钱　猪苓　泽泻各二钱　干姜炮，一二钱　吴萸五分　　水一锺半，煎七分，食远温服。[187p]

    Wujunzijian: For treating spleen and stomach deficiency with cold, vomiting, diarrhea, and dysentery accompanied by dampness.
    Ingredients:

    • 2-3 qian of ginseng
    • 2 qian each of white atractylodes (stir-fried) and white poria
    • 1 qian of honey-fried licorice
    • 1-2 qian of stir-fried dry ginger
    • 1.5 bowls of water, decoct and take.
      Add 1 qian of dried tangerine peel, named Liuwei Yigong Decoction, for symptoms of the same but with slight stagnation.

    Weiguan Decoction: For treating spleen and kidney deficiency with cold abdominal pain that does not stop, and cold diarrhea, etc.
    Ingredients:

    • 3-5 qian or 1 liang of cooked rehmannia
    • 2 qian each of stir-fried yam and stir-fried hyacinth bean
    • 1-2 qian of honey-fried licorice
    • 1-2-3 qian of scorched dry ginger and stir-fried white atractylodes
    • 5-7 fen of prepared evodia
    • 2 bowls of water, decoct to 7 parts, take warm after meals.

    Zhuoguan Decoction: For treating cold damage to the spleen with recent diarrhea and without kidney qi damage, this soup should be used to dispel cold and dampness, and to calm the spleen and stomach. This is an adjunct to Weiguan Decoction.
    Ingredients:

    • 1 qian of stir-fried magnolia bark and stir-fried dried tangerine peel
    • 2 qian each of stir-fried yam, stir-fried hyacinth bean, poria, and alisma
    • 1-2 qian each of cinnamon and stir-fried dry ginger
    • 7 fen of honey-fried licorice
    • 1.5 bowls of water, decoct and take.

    Yifujian: For treating acute injuries from cold, leading to diarrhea.
    Ingredients:

    • 1.5 qian each of magnolia bark, dried tangerine peel, and wuzhu (Evodia rutaecarpa)
    • 1 qian of honey-fried licorice

    • 1-2 qian of prepared dry ginger

    • 1.5 bowls of water, decoct to 7 parts, take warm after meals.[187p]

    　　四维散　治脾肾虚寒，滑脱之甚，或泄痢不能止，或气虚下陷，二阴血脱不能禁者，无出此方之右。　　制附子　干姜炒黄，各二钱　炙甘草一二钱　乌梅肉五分或一钱　人参一两　　右为末，和匀，用水拌湿蒸，一饭顷取起烘干，再为末，服一二钱，温汤调下。
    　　五德丸　治脾肾虚寒，或暴伤生冷，或受时气寒湿，或酒湿伤脾，腹痛作泄，或饮食失宜，呕恶痛泄痢疾等证。　　北五味二两，或以肉豆蔻面裹煨代，或用乌药　补骨脂酒炒　干姜炒，各四两　吴茱萸制　木香各二两　　汤浸蒸饼丸梧桐子大。每服六七十丸，甚者百丸，滚白汤或人参汤或米汤俱可下。
    　　复阳丹　治阴寒呕吐泄泻，腹痛痢疾等证。　　附子制　炮姜　胡椒　五味　炙甘草各一两　白面二两，炒熟　　右为末和匀，入温汤捣丸梧桐子大。每服一钱，随证用药引送下。[188p]

    Si Wei San: For treating spleen and kidney deficiency with coldness, especially in cases of severe diarrhea or unstoppable dysentery, or for those with deflated qi, and inability to control blood loss from the two yin, there are no better prescriptions than this.

    Ingredients:

    • Prepared Aconite (Fuzi)
    • Dried Ginger (Ganjiao) (both 2 qian)
    • Honey-fried Licorice (Zhicaocao) (1-2 qian)
    • Grape (Wu Mei) flesh (0.5-1 qian)
    • Ginseng (Ren Shen) (1 liang)

    Grind these into a fine powder, mix well, dampen with water and steam. After cooking, dry it again, then grind into a powder for consumption, taking 1-2 qian mixed with warm water.

    Wu De Wan: For treating spleen and kidney deficiency with coldness, applicable in cases of violent injury from cold, exposure to seasonal cold and damp, or spleen injury from alcohol, resulting in abdominal pain, diarrhea, vomiting, and other symptoms.

    Ingredients:

    • Northern Five-flavor fruit (Beiwuwu) (2 liang), or substitute with meat nutmeg powder, or use Wu Yao
    • Prepared Psoralea (Buguzhi), roasted Dried Ginger (Ganjiao), both 4 liang
    • Prepared Wu Zhu Yu, and Mu Xiang, both 2 liang

    Soak in soup, steam into pill-sized balls similar to the size of a phoenix seed. Each dose consists of 60-70 pills, or up to 100 for severe cases, to be taken with white broth, ginseng soup, or rice soup.

    Fu Yang Dan: For treating symptoms of cold-induced vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and dysentery.

    Ingredients:

    • Prepared Aconite (Fuzi), roasted Ginger (Pao Jiang), Pepper, Five-flavor fruit, and Honey-fried Licorice (all 1 liang)
    • White flour (2 liang), cooked till browned

    Grind these together into a fine powder, mix well, and form pills the size of a phoenix seed using warm water. Take 1 qian each time, adjusted according to specific symptoms.[188p]

    　　九气丹　治脾肾虚寒，如五德丸之甚者。　　熟地八两　制附子四两　肉豆蔻面煨　五味　焦姜　吴茱萸　补骨脂酒炒　荜茇炒，各二两　粉甘草一两　　炼白蜜为丸、或山药糊丸如梧桐子大。每服六七十丸或百丸，滚白汤下。

    滞下门

    　　　　单方

    　　赤痢热躁：粳米半升，水研取汁，入瓷瓶中，蜡纸封口，沉井底一夜，平旦服之有效。【《普济方》】
    　　下痢禁口：糯榖一升，炒出白花去壳，用姜汁拌湿，再炒为末，每服一匙，汤下，三服即止。【《经验良方》】[189p]

    Nine Qi Pill
    Treats spleen and kidney deficiency with cold, even more so than the Five Virtues Pill.
    Eight taels of cooked Rehmannia, four taels of prepared Aconite, five taels each of roasted Nutmeg, Five Flavors, burnt Ginger, Wu Zhu Yu, and pan-fried Bu Gu Zhi in wine, and fried Peppermint, each two taels; one tael of powdered Licorice.
    Refine into pills with white honey, or form into pills the size of a Wutong seed with yam paste. Take sixty to seventy pills or one hundred pills with boiling white soup.

    Holy Atractylodes Decoction
    Treats injuries from food or drink, cold and damp dysentery, and vomiting; especially a sacred medicine.
    Roasted Atractylodes, five to eight qian or one to two taels; roasted Dry Ginger until yellow; one to two qian of Cassia; Chen Pi optional or not.
    Use one and a half sheng of water, boil down to seven parts, and take warm.

    Stagnation at Lower Gate

    Single Prescription
    For dysentery with heat and restlessness: half sheng of polished rice, ground with water to extract juice, placed in a porcelain bottle, sealed with wax paper, and sunk in a well overnight; take in the morning for effectiveness. [From "Pujifang"]
    For diarrhea, avoid food: one sheng of glutinous millet, roasted to remove the white flowers and hulls, mixed with ginger juice and moistened, then roasted again into a powder; take one spoonful with soup, stop after three doses. [From "Experiential Good Prescriptions"][189p]

    　　赤痢不止：秫米一把，鲫鱼鲊二脔，薤白一虎口，煮粥食之。 【《普济方》】
    　　泄痢赤白：罂粟子炒，罂粟壳炙，等分为末，炼蜜丸梧子大，每服三十丸，米饮下。 【《百一选方》】
    　　热痢便血：罂粟壳酢炙一两，陈皮半两为末，每服三钱，乌梅汤下。 【《普济方》】
    　　下痢赤白：金刚根、蜡茶等分为末，白梅肉捣丸芡子大，每服五七丸，小儿三丸。白痢甘草汤下，赤痢乌梅汤下。【《简易方》】
    　　禁口痢疾：荞麦面每服二钱，砂糖水调下。
    　　久痢：阿芙蓉小豆许，空心温水化下，日一服。忌葱蒜浆水。若渴，饮蜜水解之。
    　　赤白痢下：鸦片、木香、黄连、白朮各一分，研末，饭丸小豆大，壮者一分，老幼半分，空心米饮下。忌酸物生冷油腻茶酒面，无不止者。口渴略饮米汤。　　又方：罂粟花未开时，外有两片青叶包之，花开即落，收取为末，每米饮服一钱，神效。赤痢用红花者，白痢用白花者。[190p]

    1. For continuous dysentery: Take a handful of glutinous rice, two pieces of preserved crucian carp, and a section of Chinese chives, boil them into porridge and consume.

    2. For red and white dysentery: Fry poppy seeds and roast poppy husks, mix them in equal parts into a powder, and form into pills the size of nuts with honey. Take thirty pills each time, swallowed with rice drink.

    3. For hot dysentery with blood in the stool: Use one tael of roasted poppy husk and half a tael of dried tangerine peel powdered together. Take three qian (a unit of weight) each time, with black plum soup.

    4. For red and white dysentery: Mix equal parts of diamond root and wax tea into a powder. Form pills the size of thorny walnuts with white plum flesh. Take five to seven pills each time, or three for children, and use licorice soup for white dysentery or black plum soup for red dysentery.

    5. For dysentery with restricted intake: Take two qian of buckwheat flour and mix with syrupy water to ingest.

    6. For chronic dysentery: Use a small amount of hibiscus seed, dissolve with warm water on an empty stomach, once a day. Avoid green onion, garlic, and their juices. If thirsty, drink honey water to relieve.

    7. For red and white dysentery: Take one fen each of opium, cardamom, Coptis root, and white atractylodes, grind into powder, form into pills the size of beans, one fen for strong individuals, half fen for the elderly and children, taken with rice drink on an empty stomach. Avoid sour, cold, oily, greasy, tea, alcohol, and not stopping substances. If thirsty, drink rice soup.

    8. Additionally, when poppy flowers have not yet bloomed, wrap them in two green leaves. Once they bloom, they fall off; collect them and powder them. Take one qian with rice drink; the effect is miraculous. Use red flowers for red dysentery and white flowers for white dysentery.[190p]
